intro: Piperia dilatata var. albiflora, commonly known as the white-flowered piperia, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate inflorescences. The plant features slender, hollow stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves with a smooth texture. Its flowers are small, white, and clustered in umbrella-like clusters, contributing to its ornamental value. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in woodland areas.
